channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Bank of America CEO Brian Moynihan says both consumers and businesses are ‘slowing things down’—in fact, they’re acting like its 2016, a period of ‘very low growth’
item.description: "We gotta keep the consumer in the game in the U.S. economy because it's such a big part of it."

item.title: Japan confirms first currency intervention since 2022 with $62 billion in spending
item.description: Data from Japan's Ministry of Finance confirmed the country's first currency intervention since 2022, after the Japanese yen plunged to a 34-year-low in April.

item.title: STMicroelectronics to build $5.4 billion chip plant in Italy with state support
We are entrusted with the pensions of 4.7 million American workers. We must ask private equity firms the hard questions—even if they don’t like it
item.description: The two major unions representing millions of teachers and construction workers invest in private equity—and want to hold it accountable.

item.title: Friday's analyst calls: Studio stock to rally 70%, what the Street says about Dell earnings
item.description: Dell Technologies and Lionsgate Studios were among the stocks being talked about by analysts on Friday.

item.title: U.K. government sells NatWest shares for $1.58 billion
Renault links up with Chinese partner to build $22,000 EV after VW broadside
item.description: Renault CEO Luca de Meo was critical of Volkswagen after talks over a joint affordable EV imploded.

item.title: EU's 14th sanctions package must target circumvention, energy exports, Zelenskyy advisor says
item.description: The European Union's upcoming 14th sanctions package against Russia must do more to choke off energy exports and clamp down on circumvention by third parties, an advisor to the office of Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy told CNBC.

item.title: U.K. retail footfall declined 3.6% in May despite better weather
Lab-grown meat isn’t on grocery store shelves yet, but Florida and Arizona have already banned it
item.description: Some cultivated meat companies say they’re considering legal action, and some states—like Tennessee—shelved proposed bans after lawmakers argued they would restrict consumers’ choices.

item.title: Euro zone inflation rises to 2.6% in May, but bloc still seen heading for interest rate cut
item.description: The European Central Bank is widely expected to cut interest rates next week.

item.title: Musk’s pay package ‘outsized,’ proxy adviser says, urging shareholders to say no
Women’s health has been ignored for most of history. Here’s why that’s changing—and why it’s time to double down
item.description: Women’s health could be poised to enter an era of equity—but only if founders, funders, and public partners continue to support innovation.

item.title: Austin expresses 'concern' to Chinsdefense chief over its activities in Taiwan Strait
item.description: The meeting between the two sides was the first in person talk between Chinese and U.S. defense chiefs since November 2022.

item.title: 'On Watch' podcast: Financial tips for summer travel season
